description: Current Configuration Management Policy and Procedures documentation, including version history, approval signatures, and evidence of annual review
Baseline configuration documentation for all system components, including hardware, software, firmware, network topology, and security control implementations
Configuration Management Plan (CMP) with documented roles, responsibilities, processes, configuration items, and approval records
Change Control Board (CCB) charter, membership roster, meeting minutes, and records of configuration change decisions for the past 12 months
Configuration change request records including security and privacy impact analyses, approvals, implementation evidence, and testing results for a sample of recent changes
System component inventory with accountability information (owner names, positions, roles), update timestamps, and evidence of monthly reviews
Security configuration checklists and hardening guides (DISA STIGs, CIS benchmarks, or custom baselines) applied to system components
Automated configuration management tool reports showing baseline configurations, configuration drift detection, and compliance scan results
Least functionality documentation including list of prohibited/restricted functions, ports, protocols, and services with justification for enabled services
Software allow-list (authorized software inventory) with version numbers, approval records, and evidence of quarterly reviews
Access control documentation for configuration change privileges, including role definitions, separation of duties matrix, and quarterly privilege reviews
Automated unauthorized component detection tool configuration, alert logs, and incident response records for detected unauthorized components
Test environment documentation and evidence of security testing performed prior to production implementation of configuration changes
Version control system records showing retention of previous baseline configurations to support rollback capabilities
Software license inventory and tracking records demonstrating compliance with licensing agreements and copyright laws
User-installed software policy, enforcement mechanisms (technical controls), and continuous monitoring evidence via allow-listing tools
Information location documentation identifying where Federal data is processed and stored, including system component mappings and user access records
Digital signature verification process documentation and evidence that software/firmware components are cryptographically verified before installation
Cryptographic key and certificate management records for all security controls that rely on cryptography
Audit logs demonstrating automated enforcement of configuration change restrictions and notifications to approval authorities
